definition: contrary/in reverse/inside out or upside down/to reverse/to return/to oppose/opposite/against/anti-/to rebel/to use analogy/instead/abbr. for 反切[fan3 qie4] phonetic system
to go and return/to return/to resume/to return to a normal or original state/to repeat/again/to recover/to restore/to turn over/to reply/to answer/to reply to a letter/to retaliate/to carry out
variant of 復|复[fu4]/to reply to a letter

sentences.english: Is disease of department of gynaecology gotten capricious ?
sentences.chinese: 妇科病一得就反复无常嘛？

sentences.english: Some clients feel like you exist solely to cater to their every whim.
sentences.chinese: 一些客户认为你应该完全迎合他们的反复无常。

sentences.english: It is given to all sorts of caprices of wind and weather.
sentences.chinese: 经常遇到各种各样反复无常的风和天气。

sentences.english: It's clear that some stocks are more volatile than others.
sentences.chinese: 很明显有一些股票会比其他股票反复无常。

sentences.english: Volatile law and order situation also dishearten foreign tourists.
sentences.chinese: 反复无常的法律和社会秩序也使游客同样感到沮丧。

sentences.english: The ground is capricious like elephantine cat, the disposition of persist one's old ways.
sentences.chinese: 象猫一样地反复无常，我行我素的性格。

sentences.english: It is harder to negotiate safe passage with increasingly unpredictable armed groups.
sentences.chinese: 和愈加反复无常的武装组织商定安全通道越发困难。

sentences.english: During inspiration plunder or in the process of creation, play fast and loose is its form of expression.
sentences.chinese: 在灵感掠取或创作过程中，反复无常是它的表现形式。

sentences.english: A hailstorm in July is a caprice of nature.
sentences.chinese: 七月天的一场冰雹是大自然的反复无常的变化。

sentences.english: In the tumult of battle, robots wouldn't be affected by volatile emotions.
sentences.chinese: 身处混乱的战场，机器人不会被反复无常的情绪左右。

sentences.english: The Jade Emperor's rule is orderly and without caprice.
sentences.chinese: 玉帝的规则是井然有序，不会反复无常的。

sentences.english: He was rather too indulgent in humouring her caprices.
sentences.chinese: 讲到容忍她的反复无常，他实在是太迁就了。

sentences.english: Many of these assets were funded by lenders in fickle wholesale markets.
sentences.chinese: 许多这些资产来自反复无常的批发市场。

sentences.english: He was very changeable, often blowing hot and cold.
sentences.chinese: 他朝三暮四，老是反复无常。

sentences.english: Hermia was looking at him and wondering at his strange inconstancy.
sentences.chinese: 赫米亚望着他，对他莫名其妙的反复无常感到很惊奇。

definition: two-faced, three knives (idiom); double-cross/double dealing and back stabbing
breaking faith and abandoning right (idiom); to betray/treachery/perfidy
old: to reap the consequences of one's words (idiom, from Mencius); modern: to go back on one's word/to blow hot and cold/to contradict oneself/inconsistent
serve Qin in the morning Chu in the evening (idiom); quick to switch sides
lit. see the wind and set the helm (idiom); fig. to act pragmatically/to be flexible and take advantage of the situation
to go back on one's word/to break one's promise/to be unfaithful/to be untrustworthy
lit. say three in the morning but four in the evening (idiom); to change sth that is already settled upon/indecisive/to blow hot and cold
